1903.title: Wright Brothers' First Flight
1903.description: The Wright brothers, Orville and Wilbur, make the first controlled, powered, and sustained flight in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.

1909.title: First Commercial Flight
1909.description: The first commercial airplane flight was made in France, marking the beginning of passenger aviation.

1914.title: First Aerial Combat
1914.description: During World War I, airplanes are used for the first time in combat, marking the birth of aerial warfare.

1918.title: Sopwith Camel Introduced
1918.description: The Sopwith Camel becomes one of the most famous fighter aircraft of World War I.

1927.title: Lindbergh's Transatlantic Flight
1927.description: Charles Lindbergh completes the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight from New York to Paris.

1930.title: Introduction of the Boeing 247
1930.description: The Boeing 247, the first modern airliner, is introduced, significantly improving commercial air travel efficiency.

1939.title: First Jet Fighter
1939.description: The first jet-powered fighter plane, the Heinkel He 178, takes flight in Germany.

1947.title: Chuck Yeager Breaks the Sound Barrier
1947.description: Chuck Yeager becomes the first person to break the sound barrier in the Bell X-1.

1969.title: Introduction of the Concorde
1969.description: The Concorde, a supersonic passenger airliner, makes its first flight, revolutionizing air travel with speeds over Mach 2.

2007.title: Boeing 787 Dreamliner
2007.description: The Boeing 787 Dreamliner enters service, offering improved fuel efficiency and passenger comfort with its composite materials and advanced systems.
